p.s: Working conditions in a globalised world are a very important thing, because of that I will now comment on the statmentstatement of Brian Pollard, that [...] in the twenty-first century the situation has changed workers are not being exploited by employers, now employers are being exploited by employees.

I think that in rich countryscountries like the USA that might sometimes be the case, but I think that there are more than enough people who are exploited by their employers, an example of this would be bangladeshBangladesh where many workers get nearly no pay and are working in inhuman conditions.
Even in rich countries there are many people who don't get enough money to live normalynormally.
Also it seems like the exploiting of employees will ever fully disappear.
In my opinion the statement of Brian Pollard is wrong because there are still so many workers getting exploited while the employers make a lot of money.
